page.title: 09TEN TORS
page.content: The TEN TORS expedition is held in May each year. Teams of young people make up the total of 2400 walkers. Teams have six members and cover routes of 35, 45, or 55 miles depending on their age and experience. Each route takes the team to 'Ten Tors', where check- points record their progress. Each team has to camp over night, and must carry all the food and equipment needed to do this. Although there is a time limit for completion of the course Ten Tors is not a race. Those who complete their Ten Tors receive medals and complete teams a certificate. Ten Tors is the climax of months of training by the teams, many of which travel long distances to the moor at weekends. Both the training and the expedition are valuable experiences for the young people involved.
